title: Ticket #2884: DMTCP periodic checkpoints (--interval) not working
description:
Michael Hanke writes:

With the new version the --chkpint option of the shim script has no effect. If I use --ckpint 60 I eventually see a process like this: 

  /usr/bin/dmtcp_coordinator --port 0 --exit-on-last --interval 60 --background

So I guess it arrives at dmtcp, but I don't see snapshots being created in Condor's exec dir at these intervals. However, a snapshot is created when I condor_vacate_job. And job resuming also works fine after the job is reschedules -- tested with the system_job.submit test in Pete's Condor integration.

Alan says: verify. The core problem may be upstream.
remarks:
2012-Mar-12 13:14:34 by mih:
This is an upstream bug. Condor passes the proper argument to the dmtcp_coordinator. Upstream knows about this
